p: The model assumes individuals can have up to four rotavirus infections with decreasing probabilities of infection, disease and severe disease ( ε i, α i, σ i) for each subsequent exposure ( Table 1) [ 23]. In addition, we assumed only symptomatic individuals are infectious and primary infections contribute more to transmission than subsequent infections [ 24– 27]. Only primary and secondary rotavirus infection were assumed to develop severe diarrhea. Additionally, we assumed primary infection, secondary infection, tertiary infection, and quaternary infection have the same duration of infectiousness.
